name: Pushing
description: Riding and pushing on flat ground. The foundation of everything.
tips: Keep your front foot over the bolts, push with your back foot, keep your weight centered.

name: Tic-Tac
description: Shifting weight to lift the front wheels and pivot side to side to gain momentum.
tips: Press down on the tail slightly, swing your shoulders to guide direction.

name: Manual
description: Balancing on the back wheels while rolling.
tips: Find the balance point — lean back just enough without scraping the tail. Arms help balance.

name: Nose Manual
description: Balancing on the front wheels while rolling.
tips: Shift weight forward over the nose. Harder to balance than a regular manual — use your arms.

name: Ollie
description: The foundational jump trick. Pop the tail and slide your front foot up to level out.
tips: Pop hard, slide your front foot, and jump with the board. Timing is everything.

name: Nollie
description: An ollie popped from the nose instead of the tail. Front foot pops, back foot slides.
tips: Reverse your ollie muscle memory. Pop with the front foot and slide the back foot up.

name: Switch Ollie
description: An ollie performed in switch stance (riding opposite your natural stance).
tips: Practice riding switch first. It's like learning ollie all over again with your weak side.

name: Frontside 180
description: Ollie while rotating 180° frontside (chest faces forward during rotation).
tips: Wind up your shoulders before popping. Lead with your upper body, the board follows.

name: Backside 180
description: Ollie while rotating 180° backside (back faces forward during rotation).
tips: Look over your back shoulder and commit to the rotation. Scoop the tail slightly.

name: Fakie Frontside 180
description: Frontside 180 while riding fakie (backwards in your regular stance).
tips: One of the easier fakie tricks — the rotation feels natural coming out of fakie.

name: Nollie Backside 180
description: Backside 180 popped from the nose.
tips: Pop the nose and rotate backside. Wind up your shoulders before popping.

name: Switch Frontside 180
description: Frontside 180 in switch stance.
tips: Combine switch riding confidence with frontside rotation. Commit fully.

name: Pop Shove-It
description: The board rotates 180° backside (under your feet) without a flip.
tips: Scoop the tail backside with your back foot. Keep your shoulders straight — don't rotate your body.

name: Frontside Pop Shove-It
description: The board rotates 180° frontside under your feet.
tips: Scoop the tail frontside. These feel awkward at first — keep your weight centered.

name: Fakie Pop Shove-It
description: Pop shove-it while riding fakie. Often easier than the regular version.
tips: A great beginner fakie trick. The scoop feels very natural rolling backwards.

name: Nollie Pop Shove-It
description: Pop shove-it popped from the nose.
tips: Scoop the nose to spin the board. Keep centered and catch with your back foot.

name: 360 Shove-It
description: The board rotates a full 360° under your feet without flipping.
tips: Bigger scoop than a pop shove-it. Stay directly above the board and catch it.

name: Kickflip
description: Ollie with a flick off the heelside edge of the nose to flip the board.
tips: Flick your front foot off the corner of the nose. The flick is a subtle ankle motion, not a kick.

name: Heelflip
description: Ollie with a flick off the toeside edge of the nose to flip the board the opposite direction.
tips: Flick your heel off the toe-side of the nose. Keep your shoulders parallel to the board.

name: Fakie Kickflip
description: Kickflip while riding fakie.
tips: Pop off the nose (which is now behind you) and flick. Many find this easier than regular.

name: Nollie Kickflip
description: Kickflip popped from the nose.
tips: Pop the nose and flick with your back foot. The flick direction is reversed from regular.

name: Switch Kickflip
description: Kickflip performed in switch stance.
tips: One of the hardest basic flip tricks. Requires solid switch ollie and flick control.

name: Switch Heelflip
description: Heelflip performed in switch stance.
tips: Many skaters find switch heelflips easier than switch kickflips. Commit to the flick.

name: Nollie Heelflip
description: Heelflip popped from the nose.
tips: A staple nollie trick. Pop the nose and flick your back heel off the edge.

name: Varial Kickflip
description: Pop shove-it combined with a kickflip. Board rotates 180° and flips.
tips: Scoop and flick at the same time. The board should shove-it and flip simultaneously.

name: Varial Heelflip
description: Frontside pop shove-it combined with a heelflip.
tips: Scoop frontside and flick the heel. The rotation and flip combine into one motion.

name: 360 Flip (Tre Flip)
description: 360 shove-it with a kickflip. The holy grail of flatground tricks.
tips: It's all in the back foot scoop. Flick is subtle — the scoop does most of the work.

name: Hardflip
description: Frontside pop shove-it combined with a kickflip. The board flips vertically between your legs.
tips: Scoop frontside and flick hard. Keep your legs apart to let the board flip through.

name: Inward Heelflip
description: Backside pop shove-it combined with a heelflip.
tips: Scoop backside and flick the heel. The board does a shove-it while heelflipping inward.

name: Laser Flip
description: 360 frontside shove-it with a heelflip. One of the most difficult flatground tricks.
tips: Requires incredible scoop and flick coordination. The board does a full 360 rotation with a heelflip.

name: Impossible
description: The board wraps vertically around your back foot in a full 360° rotation.
tips: Scoop straight down and wrap the board around your foot. Don't let it shove-it — it should go vertical.

name: Fakie Impossible
description: Impossible while riding fakie.
tips: The scoop feels slightly different in fakie. Many find it comparable to regular.

name: Double Kickflip
description: A kickflip that rotates twice before catching.
tips: Flick harder and higher than a single kickflip. The extra flip needs more airtime.

name: Nightflip
description: A 360 flip with a double kickflip. Extremely rare and technical.
tips: Maximum scoop, maximum flick, maximum commitment.

name: Gazelle Flip
description: 360 flip with a 360 body rotation. The board and body both spin 360°.
tips: Wind up hard, scoop the tre flip, and commit to the full body spin. Land bolts.

name: Boardslide
description: Ollie onto a rail/ledge and slide with the board perpendicular, middle of the deck on the obstacle.
tips: Ollie, turn 90°, and center your weight over the rail. Look at the end of the rail.

name: 50-50 Grind
description: Grinding on both trucks along a ledge or rail.
tips: Ollie onto the ledge and keep your weight centered. Lean slightly toward the obstacle.

name: 5-0 Grind
description: Grinding on only the back truck, like a manual on the ledge.
tips: Ollie and lean back slightly to lock in the back truck. Balance like a manual.

name: Nosegrind
description: Grinding on only the front truck.
tips: Ollie and shift weight forward to lock the front truck. Very technical — requires nose manual balance.

name: Crooked Grind
description: Nosegrind at an angle with the nose pressing into the ledge.
tips: Like a nosegrind but angled. Press the nose into the ledge to lock in.

name: Smith Grind
description: Back truck grinds while the board dips below the ledge on the toe side.
tips: Ollie and dip the nose below the ledge. The back truck locks in while the board angles down.

name: Feeble Grind
description: Back truck grinds while the board dips below the ledge on the heel side.
tips: Like a smith grind but the board goes over the other side. Commit to leaning in.

name: Overcrook
description: An exaggerated crooked grind where the board dips past the ledge.
tips: Press the nose hard into the ledge and let the board angle past it.

name: Bluntslide
description: The tail locks onto the ledge while sliding perpendicular — like a blunt stall but sliding.
tips: Ollie high, rotate 90°, and land with the tail hooking the ledge. Commit to sliding.

name: Nosebluntslide
description: The nose locks onto the ledge while sliding. One of the most stylish grinds.
tips: Very technical. Ollie, rotate, and lock the nose onto the edge. Full commitment required.

name: Kickflip Backside Boardslide
description: Kickflip into a backside boardslide on a rail or ledge.
tips: Flip the board and land into the boardslide. Requires great board control and commitment.

name: Kickflip 50-50
description: Kickflip into a 50-50 grind.
tips: Flip the board and land with both trucks on the ledge. Timing the catch is key.

name: Drop In
description: Standing at the top of a ramp and leaning in to ride down.
tips: Stomp your front foot and lean forward. The #1 mistake is leaning back — commit!

name: Rock to Fakie
description: Ride up the ramp, rock the front wheels over the coping, then come back down fakie.
tips: Let the front truck go over the coping, shift weight back, and roll back down. Don't hang up.

name: Axle Stall
description: 50-50 stall on the coping of a ramp.
tips: Ride up, turn 90° to lock both trucks on the coping, then drop back in.

name: Blunt to Fakie
description: Ride up, stall with the tail on the coping and board above the lip, then drop back in fakie.
tips: Pop up to blunt, balance momentarily, then shift weight to come back in fakie.

name: Disaster
description: Ollie to 180 above the coping, land with the middle of the board on the coping, then drop back in.
tips: Ollie, rotate 180, and stall the board on the coping before re-entering the ramp.

name: Kickflip Indy
description: Kickflip while grabbing indy (back hand grabs between the trucks on the toe side) on a ramp.
tips: Pop the kickflip off the lip, catch with an indy grab, and ride back in.

name: Fakie 360 Flip
description: 360 flip while riding fakie. Many skaters find this easier than regular tre flip.
tips: The scoop from fakie feels very natural. Pop, scoop, and catch.

name: Nollie 360 Flip
description: 360 flip popped from the nose.
tips: Extremely technical. Scoop the nose for a 360 rotation while flicking.

name: Switch 360 Flip
description: 360 flip in switch stance. One of the most respected tricks in skateboarding.
tips: Requires masterful switch ability. Every part of this trick is hard.

name: Fakie Hardflip
description: Hardflip while riding fakie.
tips: Scoop frontside from fakie and flick. Let the board flip vertically between your legs.

name: Pressure Flip
description: Flip the board using foot pressure on the edge rather than a pop and flick.
tips: Press down on the heel or toe edge to make the board flip. No ollie needed — all pressure.

name: Hospital Flip
description: Half kickflip caught upside down with your front foot, then flipped back with a scoop.
tips: Catch the board mid-flip with your front foot on the grip side, then guide it back over.

name: Casper Flip
description: Half kickflip caught underneath with your back foot, then flipped back over.
tips: Guide the half-flipped board with your back foot underneath and scoop it back to grip-side up.
